⊣ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(Vtx ` c0)= ∅)→(c0 ∈ USGraph ↔(iEdg ` c0)= ∅))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), emptycls)), wb(wcel(c0, cusgr), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls)))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), csn(c2))), wb(wcel(c0, cusgr), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls)))

comment: A class with one (or no) vertex is a simple graph if and only if it has no edges. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 13-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 18-Oct-2020.)
